content:
Diagnosis:
Clear cell renal cell carcinoma, pT3bN1M1 with IVC thrombus and bilateral pulmonary metastases

Previous treatment:
Right radical nephrectomy and IVC thrombectomy 15 March 2024
Completed 2 cycles Ipilimumab/Nivolumab combination immunotherapy

Current situation:
Progressive disease with new pulmonary nodules and enlarging mediastinal lymphadenopathy

MDT Discussion 25 April 2024:
Comprehensive review of imaging showing:
- Multiple new bilateral pulmonary nodules, largest 2.1cm right upper lobe
- Enlarging mediastinal lymphadenopathy, station 4R now measuring 3.2cm
- No evidence of local recurrence
- Brain MRI negative for metastases

Discussion points:
1. Early progression during first-line immunotherapy
2. Performance status deterioration from ECOG 1 to ECOG 2
3. New onset cough and exertional dyspnoea
4. Grade 2 immune-related hepatitis requiring prednisolone

MDT Recommendations:
1. Discontinue Ipilimumab/Nivolumab due to disease progression and toxicity
2. Switch to Cabozantinib 60mg daily once liver function tests normalize
3. Arrange urgent palliative radiotherapy assessment for symptomatic mediastinal disease
4. Continue prednisolone taper as per immune-related toxicity protocol

Plan:
1. Review in clinic next week with repeat LFTs
2. Proceed with Cabozantinib if ALT < 3x upper limit of normal
3. Clinical oncology assessment for palliative radiotherapy
4. Arrange CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after 8 weeks of Cabozantinib

primary_cancer.metastases: IVC thrombus, bilateral pulmonary metastases, mediastinal lymphadenopathy

cancer_timeline.value: Right radical nephrectomy and IVC thrombectomy
Developed grade 2 immune-related hepatitis requiring prednisolone
Multiple new bilateral pulmonary nodules, largest 2.1cm right upper lobe, enlarging mediastinal lymphadenopathy

patient_facts.value: New onset cough and exertional dyspnoea
Abnormal liver function tests due to immune-related hepatitis

status_updates.value: Metastatic renal cell carcinoma with early progression during first-line immunotherapy complicated by immune-related hepatitis
Progressive disease with new pulmonary nodules and enlarging mediastinal lymphadenopathy
Discontinue Ipilimumab/Nivolumab, plan to switch to Cabozantinib 60mg daily once liver function normalizes
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after 8 weeks of Cabozantinib
Review in clinic next week with repeat LFTs, referral to clinical oncology for palliative radiotherapy assessment
